content.text: Nina Dobrev was born in Sofia, Bulgaria and grew up in Ontario, Canada.

Dobrev hasn't spoken about her religion other than tweeting about celebrating her "Name Day." This is a Bulgarian, Eastern Orthodox (Russian or Greek Orthodox) holiday where people of a certain name are celebrated if they share their name with an Orthodox saint. Dobrev said:

content.sourceTitle: Nina Dobrev Celebrates Her Bulgarian Name Day on Cambio
content.text: In Bulgaria we have a tradition/celebration called a 'Name Day.' Each person has one – today is mine! Happy Name day to everyone else like me!
Plus, at least one source lists Dobrev among Russian Orthodox celebrities.

content.sourceTitle: Nina Dobrev Reacts to President Obama's Gay Marriage Stance
content.text: Dobrev was happy about president Obama's endorsement of same-sex marriage, saying it shouldn't be controversial because we're "living in the 21st Century."
She's a liberal, but because she's still Canadian, I couldn't go so far to say that she's a Democrat.
